titleStmt.title: Certaine inducements to well minded people, who are heere straitned in their estates or otherwise or such as are willing out of noble and pub[l]ique principles, to tran[s]port themselves, or servants, or agents for them into the West-Indies, for the propagating the Gospell, and increase of trade.

Certaine inducements to well minded people, who are heere straitned in their estates or otherwise or such as are willing out of noble and pub[l]ique principles, to tran[s]port themselves, or servants, or agents for them into the West-Indies, for the propagating the Gospell, and increase of trade.

notesStmt.note: Place of publication suggested by Wing.
Errors in paging: p. 14, 17 misprinted 41, 71, respectively.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
